intro: Rhododendron guangnanense, commonly known as Guangnan rhododendron, is a species native to southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in mountainous regions with acidic soil and high humidity. The plant features broad, leathery leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during late spring. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its robust root system and ability to thrive in cool, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
